alert.note: Alert for Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 01 at 8:37PM EDT until July 02 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT FOR WESTERN DOUGHERTY...SOUTHEASTERN RANDOLPH...CALHOUN AND SOUTHWESTERN TERRELL COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN GEORGIA... At 837 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Shellman to 9 miles northwest of Baconton, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Morgan, Albany, Edison, Arlington, Shellman, Leary, Walker, Parksville, Lockett Crossing, Carnegie, Holt, Clarks Mill, Aycock Mill, Martins Crossroads, Pachitla, Moye, Herod, Ducker, Cordrays Mill and Fountain Bridge. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee.
